violations_detected.description: Transaction involves a sender or receiver in a sanctioned jurisdiction (North Korea).
Transaction amount ($250,000) exceeds the $10,000 reporting threshold without prior due diligence or enhanced scrutiny.
Unusual transaction pattern: First-time high-value transfer to a high-risk jurisdiction (North Korea) with no prior transaction history.

alerts: Potential sanctions violation: Transaction involves North Korea, a comprehensively sanctioned jurisdiction under OFAC regulations.
Potential AML violation: Transaction exceeds $10,000 without evidence of enhanced due diligence or suspicious activity report (SAR) filing.
Unusual activity detected: No prior transactions to this receiver or jurisdiction; inconsistent with customer’s typical transaction profile.
recommendations: Immediately freeze the transaction and notify the compliance officer.
File a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) with FinCEN within 24 hours, citing potential sanctions evasion and AML concerns.
Conduct enhanced due diligence (EDD) on GreenWave Imports LLC, including source of funds and business rationale for this transaction.
Review the customer’s risk profile and update KYC records to reflect the high-risk activity.
Screen all parties involved (sender, receiver, and beneficiaries) against global sanctions lists and PEP databases.
Consider terminating the business relationship if the transaction is confirmed to violate sanctions or AML regulations.
